intro: Asplenium daghestanicum subsp. iskardense, commonly known as the Iskardense spleenwort, is a rare fern species native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, compact growth habit. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates or in shaded, moist environments. Its fronds are usually lanceolate and have a dark green color with a leathery texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanical rarity and of conservation interest.
